conclusion: The basketball is dropped from rest at height H.
The gravitational force acting on the basketball is mg.
The air resistance force is λmg.
The net force acting on the basketball during descent is mg(1 - λ).
The acceleration during descent is a = g(1 - λ).
The velocity just before impact is v_pre = √(2g(1 - λ)H).
After the collision, the basketball rebounds to a height h.
The net force during ascent is mg(1 + λ).
The acceleration during ascent is a = -g(1 + λ).
The velocity just after impact is v_post = √(2g(1 + λ)h).
The ratio r is given by r = √((1 + λ)h / (1 - λ)H).
The final answer is r = √((1 + λ)h / (1 - λ)H).
